document.title: 2020 New Jersey Student Learning Standards - Comprehensive Health and Physical Education Introduction

AB9060F33D02435E820BD8733BB26FFF.description:
Compare and contrast the various services that are available for family
members and others affected by substance disorders in the community and at the state level.

2A10185E30DE47338A207E8AC04D441A.description:
Examine how alcohol and drug disorders can impact the social, emotional, and
physical lives of friends and family members.

66D168F799EA47979A93C0F21CEF7900.description:
Determine the impact that alcohol and drugs can have on an individual’s
social, emotional, and physical well-being.

5D59AC3DA55D4253BF8F795184011432.description:
Compare and contrast the various services that are available for individuals
affected by substance disorders in the community and at the state level.

367294E9648A439D838CB58D131D3F86.description: Summarize the signs and symptoms of alcohol, tobacco, and drug disorders.

AB81F2BB436A4A2BBBF6C89E8D0401A4.description:
Analyze how the influence of peers and different social settings (e.g., home,
school, party) can result in positive and/or negative outcomes.

F1F7446985824A8E8529CD546FD269AD.description:
Explain the impact of alcohol and other drugs on areas of the brain that control
vision, sleep, coordination, reaction time, judgment, and memory.

B6B52C7EA17547ADB96020ED11ACFAA3.description:
Determine the factors that contribute to different rules, laws, and policies in
schools, communities, and states regarding alcohol, tobacco (including e-cigarettes, vaping,
cannabis products), and other drugs.

97981FEAB59D43BD9BD7EA0479B5DA90.description:
Relate the use of alcohol and other drugs to decision-making, consent, and risk
for sexual assault and abuse.

1FDDA7C8EA6B4FC5AA8D46C02D550E4A.description:
Examine how the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs by adolescents has
impacted their lives and the lives of family members socially, emotionally, and physically.

C27FCE67B52746DAB3E2620FDCE5E0B8.description:
Explain how certain methods of disease prevention, treatment strategies, and
appropriate medicine use promote health-enhancing behaviors.

AE79378ED7474DFBB6509D6FC3DA7A30.description: Explain how the immune system fights disease.

C766E4AAB1C7472DA28AFEDB9FBE076C.description:
Compare and contrast behaviors, including abstinence, to determine the
potential risk of pregnancy and/or STIs (including HIV) transmission.

4D11156DEFD2481A8FF190F7A12D6049.description: Describe the signs, symptoms, and potential impacts of STIs (including HIV).

BD87377759154EF492EBF624A6A1D98A.description:
Describe behaviors which may contribute to or prevent a person from being
susceptible to disease and illness (e.g., cardiovascular, stroke, hepatitis, sexually transmitted
infections (STIs), HIV/AIDS, breast cancer, HPV, testicular cancer).

B6ED8187CA3946D9828AEDC1B10A379A.description:
Determine the role of genetics in being susceptible to disease and health
conditions and identify the types of behavior that might reduce the risk factors.

986B1E9FCB5240D1B8FBF19A5B4B8A78.description:
Justify how the use of universal precautions, sanitation and waste disposal,
proper food handling and storage, and environmental controls can prevent diseases and health
conditions.

63E2D86AEDB14A97A6ADAA48B16476C4.description:
Evaluate the impact of technology and social media on relationships (e.g., consent,
communication, respect).

6D9EBA60B55A46C987BA7131FBCBD2D3.description:
Demonstrate strategies to use social media safely, legally, and respectfully (e.g.,
sexting, sextortion).

8E48AF2BAA47490F9F2B707495378876.description:
Determine the effectiveness of laws designed to keep children and adolescents
healthy and safe (e.g., consent, child pornography, human trafficking, parental notification,
drugs).

C5CA410F6593412BA31C57106B75D44F.description: Describe strategies that sex traffickers/exploiters employ to recruit youth.

A0A80312BAD04FE5B35B48F44E9486EB.description:
Define interpersonal and sexual violence and describe their impacts on sexual
health (e.g., sexual harassment, sexual assault, sexual abuse, incest, rape, domestic violence,
coercion, dating violence).

5C3CF554E245430AA3927A3D8E33865E.description: Define sexual consent and sexual agency.

54702C55C12749E989630F7CCA35EF51.description:
Assess the degree of risk in a variety of situations, and identify strategies needed to
reduce deliberate and non-deliberate injuries to self and others (e.g., digital safety, sexting,
dating violence, domestic violence, gang violence, human trafficking, nonconsensual sexual
encounters, other threats of violence).

41A2415AFF994C6C953373DE744E98DE.description:
Assess personal nutritional health and consider opportunities to improve health and
performance (e.g., sports drinks, supplements, balance nutrition).

C92DBA9DB229425A9861502B8CD0240D.description:
Design sample nutritional plans for families with different lifestyles, resources,
special needs, and cultural backgrounds; then consider the similarities and differences among
the plans.

7427EBC074A64E1796B3351418073A01.description:
Identify skills and healthy behaviors that can support adolescents in losing, gaining,
or maintaining healthy weights.

5409F2BA9AC349AEA6FCBDE54F98F829.description:
Analyze how culture, health status, age and access to healthy foods can influence
personal eating habits.

C149AC1C9A5B424F97E8270E94631020.description:
Evaluate personal attributes as they relate to career options in physical activity and
health professions.

D81CCA85033344EDBD11891C87332A27.description:
Develop a strategy to overcome barriers that allows for a visit in the community
that promotes physical activities.

26FADD024E37418A9C868D61B513E6C3.description:
Engages in a variety of physical activities (e.g., aerobic-fitness, strengthen,
endurance-fitness activities) using technology and cross-training, and lifetime activities.

E9E97D0C72C2403A9A48B6BBFC587792.description:
Identify and recognize factors that generate positive emotions from participating in
movement and physical fitness activities.

5FA8F73925C34FF08F90F22B18E67978.description:
Explore by leading self and others to experience and participate in different
cultures' physical fitness activities.

97C95B3496164CC09DE46F02B398BB30.description:
Explain the importance of assuming responsibility for personal health behaviors
through physical activity throughout one’s lifetime.

AF0ED6D86C204D47AA0D382C1AF4ADE2.description:
Develop and build an effective movement and physical fitness vocabulary for self,
peers, and family members that can enhance wellness.

855D01E54EDE481B8F300B98E7379041.description:
Use evidence to predict how factors such as health status, body composition,
interests, environmental conditions, healthy eating, anabolic steroids, physical activity, and
lifestyle behaviors impact personal fitness and health.

E7FE482ED4CC4FEB9FB9CF283A28B0CC.description:
Implement and assess the effectiveness of a fitness plan based on health data, the
assessment of one's personal fitness levels and monitor health/fitness indicators before,
during, and after the workout program.

F080F425D7B74763ACF11225D6BA9B8F.description:
Execute the primary principals of training (FITT) and technology for the purpose
of modifying personal levels of fitness (e.g., pedometers, heart rate monitors, health tracking
systems, wearable technology, virtual classes, exergames).

4DECC7BCB89841E0A3AB7E2E30C703CF.description: Recognize and involve others of all ability levels into a physical activity.

BCD2C3443B1748BFA8CDBB327DB4BFDA.description:
Summarize the short and long-term physical, social, mental, and emotional health
benefits of regular physical fitness activity.

F498B47B92D54F14BD041129E63BCE6F.description:
Effectively manage emotions during physical activity (e.g., anger, frustration,
excitement) in a safe manner to self and others.

5089F18394F940FCBA85E11A12140AE1.description:
Demonstrate offensive, defensive, and cooperative strategies in a variety of
games and settings.

08F3B7D757C84C709622E897D1DC584A.description:
Predict the impact of rules, etiquette, procedures, and sportsmanship on players'
behavior in small groups and large teams during physical activities and games.

634148CD87294F25AB1D80C5361A333D.description: Analyze, and correct movements and apply to refine movement skills.

07A36D1698FB424DA5F9623F234C6FEC.description:
Create and demonstrate planned movement sequences, individually and with
others, based on tempo, beat, rhythm, music, and physical activities (e.g., creative, cultural,
social, fitness aerobics, dance, yoga).

4917CE60211D43978FA1FBFF5C39B36B.description:
Demonstrate control of motion in relationship between force, flow, time, and
space in interactive dynamic environments.

58C69A39CBEC4AD3B18830071130F443.description:
Explain and demonstrate the transition of movement skills from isolated
settings (e.g., skill practice) into applied settings (e.g., games, sports, dance, recreational
activities).

DAC1EC14144C47F0ABC1A756C8DA5CBD.description:
Analyze difficult situations that might lead to feelings sadness, anxiety and or
depression and identify individuals, agencies or places in the community where assistance may
be available.

CC1D5DACE1084ABE81D61620E68A2AE8.description:
Collaborate with other students to develop a strategy to address health issues
related to climate change.

035DB9950171481E8E9357FBB39ED4BA.description:
Develop an advocacy plan regarding a health issue and share this information
in an appropriate setting.

6E153F35FBA5434CA174B719E535090F.description:
Identify medically accurate sources of information about STIs, including HIV,
such as local STIs /HIV prevention, steps to obtain PrEP and PEP, testing, and treatment
resources.

DB33AC222F24477681185455CE0A4A2D.description:
Identify community resources and/or other sources of support, such as trusted
adults, including family members, caregivers, and school staff, that students can go to if they
are or someone they know is being sexually harassed, abused, assaulted, exploited, or
trafficked.

2AACA20D9ACE41BEA421E3B16D318375.description:
Identify the state and federal laws related to minors' access to sexual healthcare
services, including pregnancy and STIs/HIV prevention, testing, care, and treatment.

1D0C202DF46942348F1B219F78A981EE.description:
Describe the state and federal laws related to age of consent, minors’ ability to
consent to health care, confidentiality in a healthcare setting, child pornography, sexting, safe
haven and sex trafficking.

57677F79EBB84AAF99D4AA48B91209A2.description:
Identify professionals at school and in the community available to assist with
health conditions and emergencies, sexual health services, life skills training and describe how
they can be accessed (e.g., suicide prevention, CPR/AED, breast self-examination, traumatic
stress).

6CBEAEEC22D4444FAEE20B7BA52628D1.description:
Develop a plan to eliminate or reduce risk of unintended pregnancy and STIs
(including HIV).

7C9DB48823B34C41A44D839CCE60AF27.description:
Identify short and long-term contraception and safer sex methods that are
effective and describe how to access and use them (e.g., abstinence, condom).

6D27D031AFC042BB80B1AB30EED21033.description: Define vaginal, oral, and anal sex.

AE7133DB6E20405CB76EBF49816BF778.description:
Identify factors that can affect the ability to give or perceive consent to sexual
activity (e.g., body image, self-esteem, alcohol, other substances).

225AE2774F764926ACACCCADFFC617ED.description:
Identify factors that are important in deciding whether and when to engage in
sexual behaviors.

EB67DF743A4A487991D6E952879CC163.description:
Examine how culture influences the way families cope with traumatic situations,
crisis, and change.

88D12DD29627499CAFA70FEEE83A016F.description:
Analyze the similarities and differences between friendships, romantic
relationships and sexual relationships.

9D94CE181F014F4787B38342625E0749.description: Compare and contrast the characteristics of healthy and unhealthy relationships.

2AC00EDE06554A1FA6C541374C82B7C0.description: Demonstrate communication skills that will support healthy relationships

9746B6ADB08244F093967ABB46BD254E.description:
Develop a plan for the school to promote dignity and respect for people of all
genders, gender identities, gender expressions, and sexual orientations in the school
community.

F9B3D2DE67D148509F0350E6530DB698.description: Differentiate between gender identity, gender expression and sexual orientation.

4FBED5A03A0748CBBF671796C1B71955.description:
Analyze how personal attributes, resiliency, and protective factors support mental
and emotional health.

D6CD3E12B65942DFBF5125FF71342535.description:
Compare and contrast stress management strategies that are used to address
various types of stress-induced situations (e.g., academics, family, personal relationships,
finances, celebrations, violence).

9CA23C8CD4754B1DBED5C6FDBF77DE32.description: Identify resources to assist with parenting.

D5B38DE9834049D5A21AE56D8667411A.description: Predict challenges that may be faced by adolescent parents and their families.

42F6B95E5A6D413786AF63CBE6F0CE15.description:
Identify prenatal practices that support a healthy pregnancy and identify where
to find medically accurate sources of information about prenatal care.

1967D8EBA6EC4E8A943BA049FE2EF009.description: Summarize the stages of pregnancy from fertilization to birth.

EBD37812E65549C6BE1EA17901579931.description:
Describe pregnancy testing, the signs of pregnancy, and pregnancy options,
including parenting, abortion, and adoption.

BFF2CFDAF8874E36A0130ADBB32CBE2F.description: Analyze the relationship between healthy behaviors and personal health.

C903B00626074EE68D808D896DE72149.description:
Describe the human reproductive systems, the external and internal body parts
and their functions, and the natural variations that exist in human bodies.

286928FE4ADE47F5BF566E72EEF2E8EE.description: Analyze how genetics and family history can impact personal health.

8B53D4F537B546AF97862D84A43580A9.description: Explain how appropriate health care can promote personal health.
